thread.title: LOOK What We Found Out About The Man Charged With Assault In Blocking Betsy DeVos From School…
thread.title_full: LOOK What We Found Out About The Man Charged With Assault In Blocking Betsy DeVos From School…

author: Nickarama
title: LOOK What We Found Out About The Man Charged With Assault In Blocking Betsy DeVos From School…
text:
10:10pm February 13, 2017   
This past week, protesters blocked Education Secretary Betsy DeVos from entering a Washington, D.C. public school in a physical fracas that made national news. 
According to Politico, at least one person has been charged with misdemeanor assault and failing to obey an officer. 
That person turns out to have been a contributor to NPR, Bilal Ahmed Askaryar, who was also a refugee from Afghanistan. He became a citizen in 2000. 
He wrote a piece for NPR last month in opposition to President Donald Trump’s travel ban. 
Askaryar is featured prominently in this video of the incident, holding a Black Lives Matter sign, yelling, “Shame!” 
From Politico: 
Askaryar, who entered his plea on Saturday in Superior Court in Washington, was given “several lawful orders” to move out of the way of a vehicle, and then pushed an individual identified as “V-1.” Listed as a factor under one of the charges is “impeding/assaulting US government cabinet member.” 
Askaryar pled not guilty. 
It’s not clear exactly who Askaryar allegedly assaulted. He was involved with a scuffle, blocking DeVos at the school steps, but he also was involved with pushing back and forth with police who were trying to clear the way for DeVos’ car to get into the school parking lot. 
But it’s good that someone was charged in this incident. 
It’s long past time when protesters start to pay the piper when their actions cross the lines. LIKE this article?
